Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: gt

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Show Graphite CLI version

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for Graphite CLI

Arguments.Name: --interactive
Arguments.Description: Prompt the user. Disable with --no-interactive

Arguments.Name: --no-interactive
Arguments.Description: Run non interactive

Arguments.Name: --quiet
Arguments.Description: Minimize output to the terminal. Implies --no-interactive

Arguments.Name: --verify
Arguments.Description: Run git hooks. Disable with --no-verify

Arguments.Name: --no-verify
Arguments.Description: Disable git hooks

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Display debug output

Arguments.Name: --cwd
Arguments.Description: Working directory in which to perform operations

Arguments.Name: aliases
Arguments.Description: Edit your command aliases

Arguments.Name: --reset
Arguments.Description: Reset your alias configuration

Arguments.Name: auth
Arguments.Description: Add your auth token to enable Graphite CLI to create and update your PRs on GitHub

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Auth token. Get it from: https://app.graphite.dev/activate

Arguments.Name: token
Arguments.Description: token

Arguments.Name: bottom
Arguments.Description: Switch to the first branch from trunk in the current stack

Arguments.Name: changelog
Arguments.Description: Show the Graphite CLI changelog

Arguments.Name: checkout
Arguments.Description: Switch to a branch. If no branch is provided, opens an interactive selector

Arguments.Name: --show-untracked
Arguments.Description: Include untracked branched in interactive selection

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: children
Arguments.Description: Show the children of the current branch

Arguments.Name: completion
Arguments.Description: Set up bash or zsh tab completion

Arguments.Name: config
Arguments.Description: Configure the Graphite CLI

Arguments.Name: continue
Arguments.Description: Continues the most recent Graphite command halted by a merge conflict

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Stage all changes before continuing

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Create a new branch stacked on top of the current branch and commit staged changes. If no branch name is specified but a commit message is passed, generate a branch name from the commit message

Arguments.Name: --message
Arguments.Description: Commit staged changes on the new branch with this message

Arguments.Name: message
Arguments.Description: message

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Stage all unstaged changes on the new branch with this message

Arguments.Name: --patch
Arguments.Description: Pick hunks to stage before committing

Arguments.Name: --insert
Arguments.Description: When true, any existing children of the current branch will become children of the new branch

Arguments.Name: name
Arguments.Description: name

Arguments.Name: dash
Arguments.Description: Open the web dashboard

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete a branch and its corresponding Graphite metadata

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Delete the branch even if it is not merged or closed

Arguments.Name: name
Arguments.Description: name

Arguments.Name: docs
Arguments.Description: Show the Graphite CLI docs

Arguments.Name: down
Arguments.Description: Switch to the parent of the current branch

Arguments.Name: --steps
Arguments.Description: The number of levels to traverse downstack

Arguments.Name: steps
Arguments.Description: steps

Arguments.Name: steps
Arguments.Description: steps

Arguments.Name: feedback
Arguments.Description: Commands for providing feedback and debug state

Arguments.Name: --print-debug-context
Arguments.Description: Print a debug summary of your repository. Useful for creating bug report details

Arguments.Name: --with-debug-context
Arguments.Description: Include a blob of json describing your repo's state to help with debugging. Run 'gt feedback debug-context' to see what would be included

Arguments.Name: message
Arguments.Description: message

Arguments.Name: fish
Arguments.Description: Set up 'fish' tab completion

Arguments.Name: fold
Arguments.Description: Fold a branch's changes into its parent, update dependencies of descendants of the new combined branch, and restack

Arguments.Name: --keep
Arguments.Description: Keeps the name of the current branch instead of using the name of its parent

Arguments.Name: get
Arguments.Description: Get branches from trunk to the specified branch from remote, prompting the user to resolve conflicts. If no branch is provided, get downstack from the current branch

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Overwrite all fetched branches with remote source of truth

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Display information about the current branch

Arguments.Name: --patch
Arguments.Description: Show the changes made by each commit

Arguments.Name: --diff
Arguments.Description: Show the diff between this branch and its parent. Takes precedence over patch

Arguments.Name: --body
Arguments.Description: Show the PR body, if it exists

Arguments.Name: --stat
Arguments.Description: Show a diffstat instead of a full diff. Modifies either --patch or --diff. If neither is passed, implies --diff

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initialize Graphite in this repository by selecting a trunk branch. Can also be used to change the trunk branch of the repository

Arguments.Name: --reset
Arguments.Description: Untrack all branches

Arguments.Name: --trunk
Arguments.Description: The name of your trunk branch. If no name is passed, you will be prompted to select one interactively

Arguments.Name: trunk
Arguments.Description: trunk

Arguments.Name: log
Arguments.Description: Commands that log your stacks

Arguments.Name: --classic
Arguments.Description: Use the old short logging style, which runs out of screen real estate more quickly. Other options will not work in classic mode

Arguments.Name: --reverse
Arguments.Description: Print the log upside down. Handy when you have a lot of branches

Arguments.Name: --show-untracked
Arguments.Description: Include untracked branched in interactive selection

Arguments.Name: --stack
Arguments.Description: Only show ancestors and descendants of the current branch

Arguments.Name: --steps
Arguments.Description: Only show this many levels upstack and downstack. Implies --stack

Arguments.Name: Number of steps
Arguments.Description: Number of steps
Log all branches tracked by Graphite, showing dependencies and info for each

Arguments.Name: long
Arguments.Description: Display a graph of the commit ancestry of all branches

Arguments.Name: short
Arguments.Description: Log all stacks tracked by Graphite, arranged to show dependencies

Arguments.Name: merge
Arguments.Description: Merge the pull requests associated with all branches from trunk to the current branch via Graphite

Arguments.Name: --confirm
Arguments.Description: Asks for confirmation before merging branches. Prompts for confirmation if the local branches differ from remote, regardless of the value of this flag

Arguments.Name: --dry-run
Arguments.Description: Reports the PRs that would be merged and terminates. No branches are merged

Arguments.Name: modify
Arguments.Description: Modify the current branch by amending its commit or creating a new commit. Automatically restacks descendants. If you have any unstaged changes, you will be asked whether you'd like to stage them

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Stage all changes before committing

Arguments.Name: --commit
Arguments.Description: Create a new commit instead of amending the current commit. If this branch has no commits, this command always creates a new commit

Arguments.Name: --edit
Arguments.Description: If passed, open an editor to edit the commit message. When creating a new commit, this flag is ignored

Arguments.Name: --interactive-rebase
Arguments.Description: Ignore all other flags and start a git interactive rebase on the commits in this branch

Arguments.Name: --message
Arguments.Description: The message for the new or amended commit. If passed, no editor is opened

Arguments.Name: message
Arguments.Description: message

Arguments.Name: --patch
Arguments.Description: Pick hunks to stage before committing

Arguments.Name: move
Arguments.Description: Rebase the current branch onto the target branch and restack all of its descendants. If no branch is passed in, opens an interactive selector

Arguments.Name: --onto
Arguments.Description: Branch to move the current branch onto

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: --source
Arguments.Description: Branch to move (defaults to current branch)

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: parent
Arguments.Description: Show the parent of the current branch

Arguments.Name: pop
Arguments.Description: Delete the current branch but reaint the state of files in the working tree

Arguments.Name: pr
Arguments.Description: Opens the pull request page for a branch or PR number. If no branch is passed, the current branch's PR is opened

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: rename
Arguments.Description: Rename a branch and update metadata referencing it. If no branch name is supplied, you will be prompted for a new branch name. Note that this removes any associated GitHub pull request

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Allow renaming a branch that is already associated with an open GitHub pull request

Arguments.Name: name
Arguments.Description: name

Arguments.Name: reorder
Arguments.Description: Reorder branches between trunk and the current branch, restacking all of their descendants. Opens an editor where you can reorder branches by moving around a line corresponding to each branch

Arguments.Name: restack
Arguments.Description: Ensure the current branch is based on its parent, rebasing if necessary. If conflicts are encountered, you will be prompted to resolve them via an interactive Git rebase

Arguments.Name: --branch
Arguments.Description: Which branch to run this command from. Defaults to the current branch

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: --downstack
Arguments.Description: Only restack this branch and its ancestors

Arguments.Name: --only
Arguments.Description: Only restack this branch

Arguments.Name: --upstack
Arguments.Description: Only restack this branch and its descendants

Arguments.Name: revert
Arguments.Description: Create a branch that reverts a commit on the trunk branch. Currently experimental

Arguments.Name: --edit
Arguments.Description: Edit the commit message

Arguments.Name: sha
Arguments.Description: sha

Arguments.Name: split
Arguments.Description: Split the current branch into multiple single-commit branches

Arguments.Name: --by-commit
Arguments.Description: Split by commit - slice up the history of this branch

Arguments.Name: --by-hunk
Arguments.Description: Split by hunk - split into new single-commit branches

Arguments.Name: squash
Arguments.Description: Squash all commits in the current branch and restack upstack branches

Arguments.Name: --message
Arguments.Description: The updated message for the commit

Arguments.Name: message
Arguments.Description: message

Arguments.Name: --edit
Arguments.Description: Modify the existing commit message

Arguments.Name: --no-edit
Arguments.Description: Don't modify the existing commit message. Takes precedence over --edit

Arguments.Name: submit
Arguments.Description: Idempotently force push the current branch to GitHub, creating or updating a pull request.  Opens an interactive prompt that allows you to input pull request metadata. 'gt ss' is a default alias for 'gt submit --stack'

Arguments.Name: --always
Arguments.Description: Always push updates, even if the branch has not changed. Can be helpful for fixing an inconsistent Graphite stack view on Web/GitHub resulting from downtime/a bug

Arguments.Name: --branch
Arguments.Description: Which branch to run this command from. Defaults to the current branch

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: --confirm
Arguments.Description: Reports the PRs that would be submitted and asks for confirmation before pushing branches and opening/updating PRs. If either of --no-interactive or --dry-run is passed, this flag is ignored

Arguments.Name: --draft
Arguments.Description: If set, marks PR as draft. If --no-interactive is true, new PRs will be created in draft mode

Arguments.Name: --dry-run
Arguments.Description: Reports the PRs that would be submitted and terminates. No branches are pushed and no PRs are opened or updated

Arguments.Name: --edit
Arguments.Description: Input metadata for all PRs interactively. If neither --edit nor --no-edit is passed, only prompts for new PRs

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Force push: overwrites the remote branch with your local branch. Otherwise defaults to --force-with-lease

Arguments.Name: --merge-when-ready
Arguments.Description: If set, marks all PRs being submitted as merge when ready, which will let them automatically merge as soon as all merge requirements are met

Arguments.Name: --no-edit
Arguments.Description: Don't edit PR fields inline. Takes precedence over --edit

Arguments.Name: --publish
Arguments.Description: If set, publishes PR. If --no-interactive is true, new PRs will be created in draft mode

Arguments.Name: --rerequest-review
Arguments.Description: Rerequest review from current reviewers

Arguments.Name: --restack
Arguments.Description: Restack branches before submitting. If there are conflicts, output the branch names that could not be restacked

Arguments.Name: --reviewers
Arguments.Description: If set without an argument, prompt to manually set reviewers. Alternatively, accepts a comma separated string of reviewers

Arguments.Name: reviewers
Arguments.Description: reviewers

Arguments.Name: --stack
Arguments.Description: Submit descendants of the current branch in addition to its ancestors

Arguments.Name: --update-only
Arguments.Description: Only update the PRs that have been already been submitted

Arguments.Name: sync
Arguments.Description: Pull the trunk branch from remote and prompt to delete any branches that have been merged. Restacks all branches in your repository that can be restacked without conflicts. If trunk cannot be fast-forwarded to match remote, overwrites trunk with the remote version

Arguments.Name: --delete
Arguments.Description: Delete merged branches (true by default; skip with --no-delete)

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Don't prompt for confirmation before deleting a branch or overwriting trunk to match remote if it can't be fast-forwarded

Arguments.Name: --pull
Arguments.Description: Pull the trunk branch from remote (true by default; skip with --no-pull)

Arguments.Name: --restack
Arguments.Description: Restack any branches that can be restacked without conflicts (true by default; skip with --no-restack)

Arguments.Name: --show-delete-progress
Arguments.Description: Show progress through merged branches

Arguments.Name: top
Arguments.Description: Switch to the tip branch of the current stack. Prompts if ambiguous

Arguments.Name: track
Arguments.Description: Start tracking the current (or provided) branch with Graphite by selecting its parent. This command can also be used to fix corrupted Graphite metadata

Arguments.Name: --parent
Arguments.Description: The tracked branch's parent. If unset, prompts for a parent branch

Arguments.Name: parent
Arguments.Description: parent

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Sets the parent to the most recent tracked ancestor of the branch being tracked. Takes precedence over `--parent`

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: trunk
Arguments.Description: Switch to the trunk branch

Arguments.Name: untrack
Arguments.Description: Stop tracking a branch with Graphite. If the branch has children, they will also be untracked. Default to the current branch if none is passed in

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Will not prompt for confirmation before untracking a branch with children

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: branch

Arguments.Name: up
Arguments.Description: Switch to the child of the current branch. Prompts if ambiguous

Arguments.Name: --steps
Arguments.Description: The number of levels to traverse upstack

Arguments.Name: steps
Arguments.Description: steps

Arguments.Name: steps
Arguments.Description: steps
